chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy L Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tommy L Hodges is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tommy L Hodges was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SA.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015

Write letter of apology to SA and be provided to agent by 12/1/22. Provide letter to agent to provide to SA if letter is appropriate. Complete criminal thinking course. Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Defendant Tommy L Hodges in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Tommy L Hodges.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. DISM cts 2, 3. 24 months probation. Argument. Restitution. Statement by DE. DNA ordered.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s)1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2, 3  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   1
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  2 year , cc to 21CM365

CONDITIONS:

-No contact with: SA

-Provide DNA sample

-Restitution: Hearing scheduled
-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015 

-Write letter of apology to SA and be provided to agent by 12/1/22. Provide letter to agent to provide to SA if letter is appropriate
-Complete criminal thinking course 

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Bond posted to be applied to restitution, remainder to fines/cc. Return any balance to poster. 

-Days credit for time already served:  6 (6/26/22 - 7/1/22)
-Days credit if revoked: 6

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K
